a.g: Recite in the name of your Lord who created -
Created man from a clinging substance.
Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Tawhid and Trust
Do you not see that the Prophet (peace be upon him) in the beginning of his affair was unveiled with the Pen (Qalam) when there was revealed to him "Read (Iqra') and your Lord (Rabb) is the Most Generous (Al-Akram), Who taught by the Pen (Qalam), taught the human (Insan) what he did not know." So the traveler (Salik) said: I have opened my sight and focused it, and by Allah I do not see a reed nor wood, nor do I know a pen except like that. So the knowledge (Ilm) said: You have indeed strayed far. Have you not heard that the furnishings of the house resemble the lord of the house? Do you not know that Allah the Exalted, His Essence (Dhat) does not resemble other essences? Likewise, His Hand (Yad) does not resemble hands, nor His Pen (Qalam) pens, nor His Speech (Kalam) other speech, nor His Writing (Khatt) other writings. And these are divine matters from the world of the Kingdom (Malakut). So Allah the Exalted is not in His Essence (Dhat) a body (Jism), nor is He in a place unlike others, nor is His Hand (Yad) flesh and bone and blood unlike hands, nor is His Pen (Qalam) from reed, nor His Tablet (Lawh) from wood, nor His Speech (Kalam) with voice and letter, nor His Writing (Khatt) number and form, nor His Ink (Hibr) vitriol and gallnut. If you do not witness this thus, then I see you only as effeminate between the masculinity of Transcendence (Tanzih) and the femininity of Anthropomorphism (Tashbih), wavering between this and that, not to these nor to those. How have you declared His Essence (Dhat) and His Attributes (Sifat) the Exalted transcendent from bodies (Ajsam) and their attributes? And declared His Speech (Kalam) transcendent from the meanings of letters and sounds, yet you hesitate regarding His Hand (Yad) and His Pen (Qalam) and His Tablet (Lawh) and His Writing (Khatt)?

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Wonders of the Heart
And the Pen (Qalam) with which Allah inscribed the sciences upon the pages of the Hearts (Qulub) runs the course of the sun's disc. And knowledge did not occur in the heart of the child before discernment because the tablet of his heart had not yet prepared to receive the essence of knowledge. And the Pen is an expression for a creation from the creations of Allah the Exalted, which He made a cause for the occurrence of the inscription of sciences in the hearts of humans. Allah the Exalted said: 'The One Who taught by the Pen (Qalam), taught the human what he did not know.' And the Pen of Allah the Exalted does not resemble the pen of His creation, just as His description does not resemble the description of His creation. So His Pen is not from reed nor wood, just as He the Exalted is not from substance nor accident.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
For there is no blessing from these worldly blessings except that it may become an affliction, but in relation to him; likewise, there is no affliction except that it may become a blessing, but in relation to a state. For perhaps a servant has what is best for him in poverty and illness, and if his body were healthy and his wealth abundant, he would become arrogant and transgress. Allah the Exalted said: 'And if Allah were to extend provision to His servants, they would certainly transgress in the earth' (42:27). And He said: 'No indeed! Verily, the human being (Al-Insan) transgresses (Layutgha) when he sees himself self-sufficient (Istaghna)' (96:6-7). And He said (in a hadith): 'Indeed, Allah protects His believing servant from the world while He loves him, just as one of you protects his sick person' (93).

a.g: Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
Have you seen the one who forbids
Have you seen if he is upon guidance
Have you seen if he denies and turns away -
Does he not know that Allah sees?
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Watchfulness and Self-Examination
And he (peace be upon him) said: 'Worship Allah as if you see Him, for if you do not see Him, indeed He sees you' - the hadith 'Worship Allah as if you see Him' has preceded. And Allah the Exalted has said: 'Is He who is standing over every soul (Nafs) by what it has earned?' And Allah the Exalted has said: 'Does he not know that Allah sees?' And Allah the Exalted has said: 'Indeed, Allah has been over you a Watcher (Raqib).' And Allah the Exalted has said: 'And those who are to their trusts (Amanat) and their covenants (Ahd) caretakers (Ra'un), and those who are to their testimonies (Shahadat) standing (Qa'imun).'
